page.title: 01MOTORWAY DECIDES LAND USE
page.content: The M2 motorway cuts this 12km square into 60% woodland/farmland to the west and 40% housing/industry to the east. { {Woodland/farmland- } The few people in this area,mostly live in the village of Burham which is surrounded by land belonging to 'Blue Circle Cement' of which 3,500 acres is run by a gamekeeper and farms let to tenants.There are some isolated houses without telephones or main drainage. { {Housing/industry- G.E.C. Avionics employ 6000 making parts for aircraft and own Rochester Airport employing 9.Nearby is a new hotel and Mid-Kent College of further education and the largest scout park in England.Only a few houses were built before 1945 and the Walderlade people mostly like where they live.
